sense.name: speech patterns, pronunciation of a language
sense.commentary: ACCENT[+quality][+pronunciation][+language][+dialect/+idiolect] Note: refers to the overall pronunciation of a language, not just a syllable (Sense 3)
sense.examples: He speaks English with a thick Russian accent. I couldn't place his accent for certain, but I'd guess southern New Jersey. These tapes will help improve your French accent.

sense.name: a stylistic quality of prominence or emphasis
sense.examples: Nutmeg and black pepper will add an accent of spice to the roasted vegetables. The red scarf added a bright accent to Mary's outfit. The carpet was blue and green with accents of gold.

sense.name: intonational stress on a syllable
sense.examples: The accent falls on the second syllable of the word 'surprise'. Sing the phrase more smoothly, without so much accent on specific syllables.

sense.name: a notational mark used in writing, diacritic
sense.examples: You must learn to recognize three different accent marks in written French. The accent over the vowel indicates that the stress falls on that syllable.

sense.name: a state of importance, priority
sense.examples: There is an accent on participation in his classes. His serving staff puts a lot of accent on the details.
